paused. All were silent, ex- pectant of what was to follow, for this was clearly only a prelude. 
"A fine lad! My wordl A fine lad! . . . f His fa- ther lies on his deathbed and he amuses him- self setting a policeman astride a bear! For shame, sir, for shame! It would be better if you went to the war." 
She turned away and gave her hand to the count, who could hardly keep from laughing. 
"Well, I suppose it is time we were at table?" said Mdrya Dmftrievna. 
The count went in first with Mdrya D
